text:
Terry Fox Continues to Inspire Global Commitment of Four Seasons Hotels and resorts to advancong cancer research Published on : Friday, September 4, 2015
Terry Fox’s Marathon of Hope continues as Four Seasons organises and participates in annual charity runs and other initiatives all over the world to raise funds toward advancing cancer research, a cause that has been supported by Four Seasons employees since Terry’s historic journey 35 years ago.
“In addition to raising much-needed funds for cancer research, the Terry Fox Run reminds us that everyone can make a difference, especially when we join together toward a common goal,” says Isadore Sharp, Founder and Chairman ofFour Seasons Hotels and Resorts.
In the company’s hometown of Toronto, Canada, employees of Four Seasons Hotel Toronto and the corporate head office organise one of the city’s largest Terry Fox Runs at Wilket Creek Park. This year, 4,500 participants are expected to run, walk, wheel and ride through 2 km, 5 km and 10 km routes on Sunday, September 20, 2015. Hundreds of Four Seasons employees and their families will volunteer by registering runners, serving food and refreshments, and helping with the children’s play area. More than CAD 380,000 was raised in 2014, and to date, more than CAD 9.5 million has been raised through this run alone. Every dollar has gone directly to the Terry Fox Foundation.
This year’s pre-event campaign kicks off with members of the Four Seasons Terry Fox Committee joining the Terry Fox Foundation to open the Toronto Stock Exchange on September 14, 2015. Corporate donations remain an important part of fundraising efforts since 1980, when since Isadore Sharp personally pledged to Terry’s cause and wrote to 999 other Canadian executives urging them to support cancer research.
On September 20, award winning broadcaster Brian Bailey is back to host the Run day, along with Matt and Candice from the Indie 88.1 Street Team. Brian will introduce Isadore Sharp and special guests John Carmichael, MP for Don Valley West, and Terry’s Team Member Vinesha Ramasamy during the opening ceremonies beginning at 8:30 am. Fitness expert Sandra Adzievski will lead the warmup ahead of the 9:00 am official start.
Participants, volunteers and their families will enjoy entertainment by The Marc Joseph Band, Common Deer, The Muso Project and ONQ. Throughout the event, there will be complimentary breakfast and BBQ, children’s activities, parking shuttles, complimentary coat check and a massage tent.
Source:-Four Seasons
